title: WARNING:tensorflow: when I run !ludwig experiment \

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

body:
**Describe the bug**

When I write - "!ludwig experiment \" I get error - 
WARNING:tensorflow
The TensorFlow contrib module will not be included in TensorFlow 2.0.
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'soundfile'


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1.  I'm using Google Colab.
2. I have wrote -
"!pip install ludwig" (I have used the updated version)
and "!gsutil cp gs://dataset-uploader/bbc/bbc-text.csv ."
So far all work fine.
3. See error -
When I write - "!ludwig experiment \"
I get - 
WARNING:tensorflow:
The TensorFlow contrib module will not be included in TensorFlow 2.0.
For more information, please see:
  * https://github.com/tensorflow/community/blob/master/rfcs/20180907-contrib-sunset.md
  * https://github.com/tensorflow/addons
  * https://github.com/tensorflow/io (for I/O related ops)
If you depend on functionality not listed there, please file an issue.

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/ludwig", line 10, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/cli.py", line 108, in main
    CLI()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/cli.py", line 64, in __init__
    getattr(self, args.command)()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/cli.py", line 67, in experiment
    from ludwig import experiment
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/experiment.py", line 28, in <module>
    from ludwig.data.postprocessing import postprocess
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/data/postprocessing.py", line 19, in <module>
    from ludwig.features.feature_registries import output_type_registry
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/features/feature_registries.py", line 42, in <module>
    from ludwig.features.audio_feature import AudioBaseFeature
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/ludwig/features/audio_feature.py", line 21, in <module>
    import soundfile
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'soundfile'




Please provide code, yaml definition file and a sample of data in order to entirely reproduce the issue.
Issues that are not reproducible will be ignored.

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 
- Python 3 version
